properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 6:07PM MST until January 30 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Douglas County in northeastern Colorado...
Northwestern Elbert County in east central Colorado...

* Until 700 PM MST.

* At 607 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from 3 miles west of Castle Pines to 3 miles east of
Elbert, or along a line extending from 17 miles south of Denver to
33 miles northeast of Colorado Springs, moving south at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 164 and 193.

Locations impacted include...
Highlands Ranch, Castle Rock, Parker, Elbert, Lone Tree, Elizabeth,
Kiowa, Larkspur, Perry Park, The Pinery, Louviers, Franktown,
Ponderosa Park, Castle Pines, Sedalia and Greenland.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads,
bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and
be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 7:00 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
